mainly UK especially in the UK parliament, a vote to support a suggestion, idea, law, etc., or a person who votes "yes": Points of order are divided into ayes and noes. The ayes are 57; the nays are 44. Compare
yea
no noun
nay the ayes have it
a phrase used in a parliament or meeting to announce that there are more votes to support a suggestion, law, etc. than votes against it, so the "yes" votes have won: All those in favour, say aye. The ayes have it. The bill is passed.
